gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA Office for Coastal Management Home Page

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata Part 2 Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This data set represents the extent, approximate location and type of estuarine and marine wetland habitats in the United States and its Territories. These data delineate the areal extent of wetlands and surface waters as defined by the National Wetland Inventory (NWI) and includes the equivalent Coastal and Marine Ecological Classification Standard (CMECS) units. Certain wetland habitats are excluded from the NWI program because of the limitations of aerial imagery as the primary data source used to detect wetlands. This data set is neither designed nor intended to represent legal or regulatory products. For wetland information visit www.fws.gov/wetlands/.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString:
The native coordinate system for this layer is Geographic Coordinate System North American 1983 (NAD 83).
GCS_North_American_1983 WKID: 4269 Authority: EPSG
Angular Unit: Degree (0.0174532925199433) Prime Meridian: Greenwich (0.0) Datum: D_North_American_1983 Spheroid: GRS_1980 Semimajor Axis: 6378137.0 Semiminor Axis: 6356752.314140356 Inverse Flattening: 298.257222101
Please note: all MarineCadastre.gov data served by the NOAA Office for Coastal Management and hosted through Esri REST services are in the Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere (Geographic Coordinate System WGS 1984) projection.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA Office for Coastal Management Home Page
File geodatabase feature class with layer file and metadata.
Esri REST tile cached map service for layer in web mercator projection.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.

Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.
These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Go to https://www.fws.gov/wetlands/Data/State-Downloads.html and download all geodatabase zip files Unzip files and in each geodatabase, add the _Wetlands feature class to ArcMap For each, Select by Attributes where WETLAND_TYPE = Estuarine and Marine Wetland and export into a new feature class Merge the exported feature classes into a single feature class Union the single feature class and Intersect to find overlapping features Delete/Merge any overlapping features based on state and ATTRIBUTE Crosswalk CMECS info into attribute field using table found at https://www.fws.gov/wetlands/documents/NWI_Wetlands_and_Deepwater_Map_Code_Diagram.pdf Delete all superfluous fields Check geometry and project data into WGS 1984 Auxiliary Sphere
